events.title: Latinx Thriving Initiative (LTI): Graduate Student Convivencia: Creando y Cosechando Comunidad
events.description: A graduate student convivencia aimed at connecting and building community, while also learning about key graduate student resources, campus offices, and student organizations.

events.title: REI Colloquium: How Schools Make Race: Teaching Latinx Racialization in America
events.description: A colloquium exploring how schools shape racialization, focusing on the Latinx experience in America.

events.title: Four Years On: The Russia-Ukraine War
events.description: A discussion or lecture reflecting on four years since the start of the Russia-Ukraine War.

events.title: Zionism Through (Other) Diasporic Eyes: On Asian Americans and the Politics of Solidarity
events.description: A seminar exploring Zionism from the perspective of other diasporic communities, specifically Asian Americans and the politics of solidarity.

events.title: Bancroft Roundtable - Translating Saints: Nahua-Catholic Knowledges in the Bancroft Nahuatl Manuscript Collection
events.description: A roundtable discussion on the translation and interpretation of Nahua-Catholic knowledges found in the Bancroft Library's Nahuatl manuscript collection.

events.title: Close, Distant, Embodied, Artificial: Modes of Reading Today
events.description: A seminar exploring various contemporary modes of reading, from close analysis to distant reading, embodied experiences, and artificial intelligence applications.

events.title: Rita Palacios | Mesoamérica Undone: Reframing the Conversation through Maya Understandings of Space and Time
events.description: A lecture by Rita Palacios discussing Mesoamerica and reframing conversations through Maya understandings of space and time.

events.title: Ulrike von Hirschhausen: Spaces of Contested Statehood: A Legacy of Empire
events.description: A lecture by Ulrike von Hirschhausen on contested statehood and the enduring legacy of empire.

events.title: Ali H. Musleh: Matériel for Thought: On Gaza and Sovereign Performativity
events.description: A presentation by Ali H. Musleh on 'Matériel for Thought,' focusing on Gaza and sovereign performativity.

events.title: UndocuGrads: 25-26 Life After Berkeley Webinars
events.description: A webinar series for undocumented graduate students exploring options and resources for life after Berkeley.

events.title: Taxes Made Simple: What Undocumented and International Students Need to Know
events.description: A workshop simplifying tax information for undocumented and international students at UC Berkeley.

events.title: Live Income Tax Workshop
events.description: A live workshop providing guidance on income tax for UC Berkeley students and scholars.

events.title: Career Counseling 1:1's Drop Ins
events.description: Drop-in career counseling sessions for graduate students.

events.title: Career Counseling 1:1's Drop Ins
events.description: Drop-in career counseling sessions for graduate students.

events.title: Career Counseling 1:1's Drop Ins
events.description: Drop-in career counseling sessions for graduate students.

events.title: The Grad Student Productive
events.description: A session designed to help graduate students enhance their productivity.

events.title: Film Screening – “Two English Girls”
events.description: A screening of the film “Two English Girls.”

events.title: The Loft Hour: Chris Batterman Cháirez + Cathy Lu
events.description: An arts event featuring Chris Batterman Cháirez and Cathy Lu during The Loft Hour.

events.title: Film Screening – “In the Mood for Love”
events.description: A screening of the acclaimed film “In the Mood for Love.”

events.title: Martha Graham Dance Company: GRAHAM100
events.description: A performance by the renowned Martha Graham Dance Company, celebrating GRAHAM100.

events.title: 50th Year Anniversary Banff Centre Mountain Film Festival World Tour
events.description: Screening of adventurous films from the Banff Centre Mountain Film Festival World Tour.

events.title: Black History Month Art Exhibit
events.location: Student Union, MLK Jr. Building, UC Berkeley
events.description: An exhibit showcasing student works of art in honor of Black History Month.

events.title: Crafter Dark: Beaded Potted Plant & Live Music from Cub Concerts
events.description: A crafting event to make beaded potted plants, accompanied by live music from Cub Concerts, offering a creative study break.

events.title: DIY Shirt Patches Workshop
events.description: A workshop where students can create their own DIY shirt patches.

events.title: California Women's Basketball vs Virginia
events.description: The Cal Golden Bears women's basketball team faces Virginia in an ACC conference game.

events.title: Cal Invitational Speech and Debate Tournament
events.description: The annual Cal Invitational Speech and Debate Tournament, featuring various competitive speech and debate events.

events.title: California Women's Basketball vs Virginia Tech
events.description: The Cal Golden Bears women's basketball team plays Virginia Tech in an ACC conference matchup.

events.title: California Men's Basketball vs SMU
events.description: The Cal Golden Bears men's basketball team hosts SMU.

events.title: Cal Men's Tennis vs. TBD
events.description: The Cal Men's Tennis team competes against an opponent to be determined.

events.title: Cal Women's Tennis vs. TBD
events.description: The Cal Women's Tennis team competes against an opponent to be determined.

events.title: Cal Baseball vs. TBD
events.description: The Cal Golden Bears baseball team plays a home game against an opponent to be determined.

events.title: Cal Softball vs. TBD
events.description: The Cal Golden Bears softball team plays a home game against an opponent to be determined.

events.title: Cal Men's Soccer vs. TBD (Exhibition)
events.description: The Cal Men's Soccer team plays an exhibition match.

events.title: Cal Women's Water Polo vs. TBD
events.description: The Cal Women's Water Polo team competes at home.

events.title: LGBTQ+ Grad Welcome Spring 2026
events.description: A welcome event for LGBTQ+ graduate students to connect and socialize for Spring 2026.

events.title: Valentine's Day Event
events.location: MLK Jr. Building, Game Zone Area, UC Berkeley
events.description: Celebrate Valentine's Day with free treats, crafts, and more at the Student Union.

events.title: Movie Night at Headlands (She's the Man screening)
events.description: A fun movie night featuring a screening of the romantic comedy 'She's the Man,' free for all UC Berkeley students.

events.title: Lunar New Year Celebration
events.location: MLK Jr. Building, Game Zone Area, UC Berkeley
events.description: Celebrate the Year of the Horse with free activities and treats at the Student Union.

events.title: Crafter Noon: Make Your Own Blind Box Charms
events.description: A crafting event to make blind box charms, hosted in partnership with Cub Concerts.

events.title: Black History Month Celebration
events.description: An event to honor Black History Month, featuring free treats and student works of art.

events.title: Drag Bingo
events.description: An unforgettable night of laughter, prizes, and treats hosted by Thee Leggy Pee.

events.title: St. Patrick's Day Celebration
events.description: Celebrate St. Patrick's Day with sweet treats, crafts, and more at the student union.

events.title: Game Night with Board Games at Berkeley
events.description: An evening of fun to try out new games with friends, or bring your own, with provided treats.

events.title: Graduate Student Patio Party
events.description: A patio party for graduate students to enjoy tasty bites, in partnership with the Graduate Social Club and Grad Division.

events.title: Accelerating Chemistry and Materials Innovation with NVIDIA ALCHEMI
events.description: A presentation on leveraging NVIDIA ALCHEMI to accelerate innovation in chemistry and materials science.

events.title: BETR/EECS Solid State Technologies Seminar: Dr. Dogus Cubuk, Periodic Labs | Combining Experiments, Large Language Models, and Theory to Discover Quantum Materials
events.location: Hogan Room, Cory Hall (room 521), UC Berkeley
events.description: A seminar by Dr. Dogus Cubuk on integrating experiments, large language models, and theory for quantum materials discovery.

events.title: Dissertation Talk: Sampling for Statistical Inference and Machine Learning
events.description: A dissertation talk focusing on sampling techniques for statistical inference and machine learning applications.

events.title: BSAC Technology Seminar: Prof. Kenichi Soga, UC Berkeley | Smart Infrastructure
events.description: Professor Kenichi Soga presents on smart infrastructure technologies. Advance registration is required.

events.title: Introduction to Zotero (Zoom)
events.description: Learn to use Zotero for citation management, including importing, exporting, and sharing resources.

events.title: Research 101 (Virtual)
events.description: A virtual workshop for undergraduate students on starting annotated bibliographies and finding peer-reviewed articles.

events.title: The Science of Generalizable Robot Manipulation: Perception, Control, and the Physics of Contact
events.description: A seminar on achieving generalizable robot dexterity through understanding perception, control, and contact physics.

events.title: OSPO Monthly Meetup: February
events.description: A monthly meetup for the Open Source Program Office (OSPO) community.

events.title: Publish Digital Books & Open Educational Resources with Pressbooks
events.description: A workshop on using Pressbooks to self-publish digital books and open educational resources.

events.title: Developing open source air quality datasets for public health policy action (Bay Area Open Science Group February Meeting)
events.description: A meeting discussing the development of open-source air quality datasets for public health policy.

events.title: Roadmap Workshop for JupyterHub and Binder
events.description: A workshop to discuss the roadmap for JupyterHub and Binder development.

events.title: Controllable AI: Control Theory meets Artificial Intelligence
events.description: A seminar exploring the intersection of control theory and artificial intelligence for controllable AI systems.

events.title: SCET Collider - Startup Showcase and Networking
events.location: Memorial Stadium, End Zone, UC Berkeley
events.description: A showcase of student startups and an opportunity for networking with the entrepreneurship community.

events.title: Haas Energy Institute Research Seminar Series
events.location: Haas School of Business, UC Berkeley
events.description: A research seminar series featuring presentations on various topics in energy and entrepreneurship.

events.title: CITRIS Research Exchange: Innovation in Robotics for Social Good
events.location: Sutardja Dai Hall, UC Berkeley & Online
events.description: A research exchange highlighting innovations in robotics with a focus on their social impact and entrepreneurial opportunities.

events.title: Berkeley Founders' Workshop: Legal Basics for Startups
events.location: Chou Hall, Haas School of Business, UC Berkeley
events.description: A workshop for aspiring founders covering essential legal considerations for launching a startup.

events.title: The Collider Cup Competition
events.description: SCET's annual startup competition showcasing top student ventures. Winners receive funding and mentorship.

events.title: Blum Center Innovators' Forum: Scaling Social Impact
events.description: A forum featuring innovators discussing strategies for scaling social impact initiatives and enterprises.

events.title: FinTech Startup Pitch Night
events.location: Haas School of Business, UC Berkeley
events.description: An event where FinTech startups pitch their innovative ideas to a panel of judges and investors.

events.title: Cleantech to Market (C2M) Showcase
events.organizer: Haas School of Business, Energy Institute
events.location: Haas School of Business, UC Berkeley
events.description: Students present their market-entry strategies for promising cleantech innovations.

events.title: SkyDeck Demo Day (Spring 2026)
events.description: Showcase of the latest batch of SkyDeck startups to investors and the UC Berkeley community. This is a major event for the entrepreneurial ecosystem.

events.title: Healthcare Innovation Challenge Final Pitches
events.organizer: Berkeley Bioengineering Department & Haas School of Business
events.description: Student teams present their final pitches for innovative solutions to healthcare challenges.
